type.name: affected_item_select
type.description: This selects between a particular version, view definition, or occurrence of a part.

type.name: status_value
type.description: This provides an enumeration of valid status values for a Work_request.

type.name: work_request_organisation_or_person_in_organisation_item
type.description: This select extends the assignments of an organization or a person in an organization to Work_request instances.

type.name: work_request_date_or_date_time_item
type.description: This select is a extends the assignments of a date or a date and time to Work_request instances.

type.name: work_request_approval_item
type.description: This select extends an approval_assignment to apply to Work_request instances.

entity.name: Activity_method
entity.description: An Activity_method is a way and/or means to accomplish an activity's objectives and effects.

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: words by which the Activity_method is known.

explicit.name: consequence
explicit.description: the result (positive and/or negative) of this method.

explicit.name: purpose
explicit.description: an informal description of the reason for the Activity_method.

entity.name: Work_request
entity.description: A Work_request is an official request that identifies the need for a potential release or change of functionality of a part. These requests may or may not ever actually be incorporated, depending upon the level of authorization granted to the request and its associated work order.

explicit.name: version_id
explicit.description: specifies the identification of the version of the Work_request.

explicit.name: status
explicit.description: a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the Work_request.

explicit.name: purpose
explicit.description: an informal description of the reason for the Work_request.

explicit.name: potential_solutions
explicit.description: specifies potential solutions associated with the Work_request.

explicit.name: affected_items
explicit.description: a set of the items of product data that are potentially within the scope of the Work request.

inverse.name: requestor
inverse.description: the organisation or person in organisation that requested the work.

inverse.name: request_date
inverse.description: the date or date and time the request was created.

inverse.name: approval
inverse.description: the approvals for the Work request.

where.label: WR1
where.description: The requestor role must be 'requestor' or the requestor may not exist.

where.label: WR2
where.description: The request_date role must be 'request_date' or the request_date may not exist.
